sentence.Network_en: Soiled by her imposture she remains silent.
sentence.Network_cn: 她背着冒名顶替者的黑锅却一直沉默。

sentence.Network_en: What tithes and tricks but an imposition, all a confounded imposture ? - and I can prove it.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一件事情最让他觉得噩梦般骇人, 便是他从来闹不清楚,为什么要这般大张旗鼓地搞欺骗.

sentence.Network_en: What are an imposition, all a confounded imposture? - and I can prove it.
sentence.Network_cn: 什么 是宗教税,什么是宗教礼节, 都是骗人的,乱七八糟的事,我并且可以证实.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: via French from late Latin impostura, from Latin imposit- 'imposed upon', from the verb imponere (see impose)

auth_sentence.content: The heart of the narrative is the dragging out, bit by bit, of the great imposture that made Silk's career possible.

auth_sentence.content: So as long as I was loaded, no matter how prolific or accomplished I was, I felt that it was an act of imposture.
